communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IVAS Tropics Test (US ARMY)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports show that 3rd Battalion, 75th Ranger Regiment tested the Integrated Visual Augmentation System (IVAS) at Camp Santiago's Joint Readiness Training Center in Puerto Rico: https://www.peosoldier.army.mil/News/Article-Display/Article/2909702/a-day-in-the-sun-ranger-execution-and-national-guard-support-to-ivas-tropics-te/
and https://www.nationalguard.mil/News/Article/2927151/rangers-and-national-guard-support-ivas-tropics-test/fbclid/rangers-and-national-guard-support-ivas-tropics-test/

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) All instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials related to testing the IVAS at Camp Santiago. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed IVAS at Camp Santiago and B) any other documents related to IVAS, including internal documentation, public relations materials, after action reviews, and executive summaries.

2) Any messages, communications, emails, and associated attachments shared with local, state, and federal agencies to promote "situational awareness" of IVAS training at Camp Santiago. These emails, messages, and associated attachments can include but are not limited to A) communications  inviting local, state, and federal agencies to participate in training exercises and B) communications letting local, state, and federal agencies know about activities taking place during the military training.

3) Any internal or external organizational charts created during the lead up to the IVAS tropics test showing the command structure to be followed during the military training exercise. 

4) Any attendance sheets produced during the course of the IVAS tropics test at Camp Santiago.

5) Any maps created during the course of the IVAS tropics test at Camp Santiago.

6) Any recordings, videos, and/or images produced during the course of the IVAS tropics test at Camp Santiago. The articles mentioned above note that there is a "detailed 'virtual playback' of the executed scenario" created by the IVAS during testing.

7) To the extent possible, any emails and associated attachments that mention IVAS testing and training at Camp Santiago.

To help limit the extent of the responsive documents, please limit search from Jan 1, 2021 through Jan 1, 2022. Please deliver these documents on a rolling basis as responsive documents are found. You can treat #7 (emails) as a separate request because I suspect there will be many more responsive documents there.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. It will be used in the course of reporting for Marea Ecologista, an independent journalism outlet. (https://mareaecologista.com/)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Vigilant Defender 23 Information (US ARMY)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

According to this article (https://www.usar.army.mil/News/Article/3503100/army-counterintelligence-agents-train-in-puerto-rico-during-vigilant-defender-23/) published on the US Army Reserve official website, Vigilant Defender 23 took place between July 8-21, 2023  in Puerto Rico and involved the 752nd Military Intelligence Battalion (Counterintelligence), Interrogation Group, Military Intelligence Readiness Command. The article also notes that Army Reserve's 1st Mission Support Command supported training and that Col. Carlos Caceres,  commander of the 1st Mission Support Command, "brought in all his local contacts with the state police, Army Reserve, National Guard, FBI. He invited whoever was out there to come meet with us to discuss our event.” The article says "approximately 200 personnel participated."

Therefore, I request the following records:

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials related to and used during  Vigilant Defender 23. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discussed Vigilant Defender 23, B) any notes taken during meetings that took place during Vigilant Defender 23 training, and C) any other documents related to Vigilant Defender 23, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any messages, emails, and associated attachments shared with local, state, and federal agencies to promote "situational awareness" of the Vigilant Defender 23 military training and the presence of counterintelligence agents in Puerto Rico. These emails, messages, and associated attachments can include but are not limited to A) communications  inviting local, state, and federal agencies to participate in training exercises and B) communications letting local, state, and federal agencies know about activities taking place during the military training.

3) Any internal or external organizational charts created during the lead up to Vigilant Defender 23 showing the command structure to be followed during the military training exercise. 

4) Any attendance sheets produced during the course of the Vigilant Defender 23 military training exercise.

5) To the extent possible, any emails and associated attachments that mention Vigilant Defender 23.

To help limit the extent of the responsive documents, please limit search from Jan 1, 2023 through the time this request is processed. Please deliver these documents on a rolling basis as responsive documents are found. You can treat #5 (emails) as a separate request because I suspect there will be many more responsive documents there.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. It will be used in the course of reporting for Marea Ecologista, an independent journalism outlet. (https://mareaecologista.com/)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Santa Rita intake data records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records (reports, memoranda, spreadsheets, emails) that contain aggregate information from any and all fields, gathered during the Sheriff’s Office intake questionnaires at Santa Rita Jail since January 1, 2023. 

My understanding from ACSO staff at Santa Rita Jail interviewed on March 4, 2024, is that the Sheriff’s Office conducts such a questionnaire with every person entering the jail, including: information on classes, vocational training, and other resources of interest to the person, Medi-Cal enrollment status, county of residence, whether the person is a sole provider, has minor children, is a military veteran, probation status, and demographic information. 

This information will be shared with members of the Justice Reinvestment Coalition and others.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

title: STL Fusion Center MOUs, MOAs, NDAs 2020-2024

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: STL Fusion Center MOUs, MOAs, NDAs 2020-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law., I hereby request the following records for the fiscal years of 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 and current fiscal year of 2024.

• Records that show Memorandums of Understanding (MOUs), Memorandums of Agreement (MOAs), Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) and other coordination, cooperation, or other resource or information sharing arrangements between St Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group and federal, state or local agencies specifically including but not limited to law enforcement agencies

• Records showing the number of times information which was uploaded to the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group’s intelligence databases required correction or removal because the information was found to be erroneous, deficient or invalid

• Records showing the number of times information which was uploaded to the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group’s intelligence database required correction or removal because the source agency that provided information was found to lack authority to gather or share information

• Records showing the number of suspicious incident reports, suspicious activity reports, and field interview reports in the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group Intelligence databases

• Records that list all public agencies and/or private contractors providing services of any kind to St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group

• Records that show the number of tips and leads in the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group’s intelligence databases received from intelligence information shared via email, phone, internet or submission of incident reports

• Records that show the number of tips and leads in the St. Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group’s intelligence databases acquired from cellphone tower dumps, cell site simulators (commonly known as “Stingrays”), and surveillance cameras

• Copies of all contracts/agreements signed by the St Louis Fusion Center: Terrorism Early Warning Group

As the records sought detail the operations and activities of our government, I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest. I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am willing to pay all reasonable duplication expenses incurred in the processing this Sunshine Law request. However, as I am a member of the public and requesting documents specifically for the purpose of increasing the public’s knowledge of governmental functioning, I will administratively appeal any denial of my request for a fee waiver.

If fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: U.S. Attorney General records re: Lloyd Blankfein, Timothy Geithner, Henry Paulson, et-al.. (Department of Treasury)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I hereby request the following records:
Any and all files, court records and legal proceedings memorandums, dispositions or current criminal status at any and all courts of record on file with the U.S. Government and particularly U.S. Attorney General's Office and as pertains to legal proceedings of Wednesday, the 16 December 2009, and which implicated various Interpol Agency and International Court of Justice (ICJ) Den Hague Cite, Holland, Europe initiated mass arrests of the following: Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein, former U.S. Treasury Secretaries Timothy Geithner and Henry Paulson, et-al...

See also prior documentation related to this past (and current) chain of events:
https://christopherstoryarchive.wordpress.com/2017/02/20/treasury-secretary-read-his-rights-and-tagged/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

HM Elizabeth Sherry

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Richard Hibey
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Richard Anthony Hibey. He was born on 20 June 1941 in Utica, New York, USA. He died on 19 February 2024.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

Mr. Hibey was a prominent defense lawyer, famous for his work on cases of international intrigue. His clients included Philippines autocrat Ferdinand Marcos and Navy intelligence analyst Jonathan Pollard who leaked secrets to Israel. He also represented Clair Elroy George, a former head of the CIA’s clandestine service who was accused of making false statements to Congress about the Iran-Contra affair.

PROOF OF DEATH
Attached is Mr. Hibey’s obituary from the Washington Post. 

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH

Please conduct a cross-reference search of your files on the following people and organizations to see if they contain additional records related to Mr. Ahearn:

(1) Ferdinand Marcos
(2) Jonathan Pollard
(3) Clair Elroy George

FEES

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you nonetheless decide to charge me fees, please inform me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25. 

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you for your processing of this request.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Richard Hibey
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

Here is Mr. Hibey’s obituary, which I submit as proof of his death.

RE:          Acknowledgement of Records Request                  Ticket ID# 24-676


Dear Michael Locke,
We have received your public records request.

Your request will be processed in accordance with the Florida Public Records Law.

Please be advised there are potentially fees to cover the cost of reproduction, including copier expenses, supplies and staff time associated with all requests.  You will be advised as soon as possible regarding estimated costs.  Payment will be due in advance by check or money order made payable to the School Board of Brevard County.  If the actual cost is more than the estimate, your records will be released when payment in full has been received.  If the actual cost is less than the estimate, a check for reimbursement will be requested and mailed to you.

PLEASE NOTE: Not all completed public records are in a digitized format.  To receive a digitized version of a redacted record may require additional time and resources, resulting in additional expense.

You will be notified if records are exempt from public disclosure.  Under public records laws, the district is not obliged to create a new document or records in response to a request for public records.  Likewise, the district will not acquire computer software for the sole purpose of providing access or delivery of public records that are accessible by other means.

If you have any questions, please contact me at recordsrequest@brevardschools.org<mailto:recordsrequest@brevardschools.org>.

Holly Christmas

Brevard Public Schools
Division of Government and Community Relations
2700 Judge Fran Jamieson Way
Viera, FL  32940

title: University of Houston - Shahzia Sikander "Satanic" displays

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: University of Houston - Shahzia Sikander "Satanic" displays
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any Public Information Act requests concerning the Shahzia Sikander works, as well as any communications to or from the requestor concerning the request, and any records produced in response to the request.

2. Any agreements concerning the acquisition, display, or other use of any of the Sikander works.

3. Any records concerning the decision to cancel or postpone the February 28, 2024, program concerning the works, including (but not limited to) any records relating to the unavailability of the artist.

4. Any communications to or from any elected official and the University of Houston concerning the Sikander works.

5. Any communications to or from any member of the Board of Regents concerning the Sikadner works.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of records held by faculty or students.

Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

March 8, 2024
Food and Drug Administration

title: Roger Guarino child sexual abuse lawsuit

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Roger Guarino child sexual abuse lawsuit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request records related to child sexual abuse lawsuit against Roger E Guarino (DoB: 9/14/1967), the Sodexo operations manager assigned to MCC until February 2022. 

## Specific records 

I am seeking the following specific records:
1.) Any communications with Sodexo regarding the lawsuit or Roger Guarino's status at MCC.
2.) Any communications between MCC and Roger Guarino regarding the lawsuit or any steps taken by MCC in response to the lawsuit.
3.)  Any communications with any other educational institution regarding Roger Guarino, including any communications with the University of Arkansas - Little Rock, where Sodexo reassigned Roger Guarino to another position that involved interacting with children despite being aware of the child molestation lawsuit.

## Affiliated entities

My request includes any records that may in the custody of the Monroe Community College Foundation, a non-profit associated MCC. Such records constitute "material received by a corporation providing services for a State university and kept on behalf of the university" (Encore Coll v. Auxiliary Serv NY Court of Appeals (1995) 87 N.Y.2d 410,414) and are thus "a record subject to disclosure under FOIL" (id.). 

## Fees

In the event that there are fees in excess of $200, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edward

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Roger Guarino child sexual abuse lawsuit
communications.communication:
Dear Edward,

This is in response to your Freedom of Information request dated March 8, 2024 for records related to Sodexo.  Sodexo is under contract with the MCC Association, Inc,. a not-for-profit organization.  Monroe Community College is not a party to information regarding Sodexo and does not maintain documentation related to it.  As such your request is denied.

Any appeal of this decision should be sent to Mr. Gregory Hinton, Chief Financial Officer and Vice President, Administrative Services, Monroe Community College, 1000 E. Henrietta Road, Rochester, NY 14623 within 30 days.

Sincerely,

Dolores Pasto-Ziobro
Records Access Officer

[Monroe Community College]<http://www.monroecc.edu/>

communications.subject: FOIA NOTICE - 200000000664 & 200000000689 - Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Law Enforcement Agencies accessing statewide LexisNexis/West personal information databases
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Tepper,



This notice is in response to your request dated March 7, 2024  (below) for information under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), MCL 15.231 et seq.  Your request was received by the Department of Technology, Management and Budget, Central Procurement Services, on March 8, 2024.  You have requested:

I am seeking any agreements, documents, reports, communications, lists, logs or datasets showing the names of the state and local law enforcement agencies that have bought or can use services through the following Personal Information Database contracts: LexisNexis Risk Solutions, Contract #: 200000000664 and West Publishing Corporation, a Thomson Reuters business, Contract #: 200000000689.

The following action has been taken in response to this request:

REQUEST GRANTED IN PART, DENIED IN PART, as follows:



REQUEST PARTIALLY GRANTED:

We have identified records believed to be responsive to your request. Your request is granted as to existing, non-exempt records which are within the possession of the DTMB, and which fall within the scope of your request.  The requested records are attached.


Section 4(5) of the FOIA, MCL 15.234(5), provides that a public body must notify the requester in writing if all or a part of the requested information is available on the public body's website.  Please be informed that all or parts of the records you have requested are available without charge at: State of Michigan, DTMB contracts may be available free of charge at: DTMB - Contract List (michigan.gov)<https://www.michigan.gov/dtmb/procurement/contractconnect/contract-list>



REQUEST PARTIALLY DENIED:


MCL 15.232(e), Records Not Possessed by DTMB

To the best of the Department's knowledge, information, and belief, DTMB does not maintain or possess public records as that term is defined under section 2(e) of the FOIA, MCL 15.232(e), under the name given in your request or by another name reasonably known to the Department, to wit, agreements, documents, reports, communications, lists, logs or datasets showing the names of the local law enforcement agencies that have bought or can use services through the following Personal Information Database contracts: LexisNexis Risk Solutions, Contract #: 200000000664 and West Publishing Corporation, a Thomson Reuters business, Contract #: 200000000689



MCL 15.233(3)(1) Request Overly Broad

MCL 15.233, Sec. 3 (1) provides that a requesting person must describe a public record sufficiently to enable the public body to find the record.  Regarding any agreements, documents, reports, communications, lists, logs or datasets, this part of your request does not describe records sufficiently to enable the department to determine what records you are seeking. It is hereby certified that, to the best of the undersigned's knowledge, information, and belief, records do not exist within the department under the description you provided or under another name reasonably known to the department.



MCL 15.233(3)(4) Compile or Create a New Record

MCL 15.233, Sec. 3 (4) provides that a public body is not required "to make a compilation, summary, or report of information..." in response to a request.  You have not described existing public records within this department pursuant to section 3(1) of the FOIA. Therefore, your request is denied pursuant to section 3(4) and (5) of the FOIA, to wit, agreements, documents, reports, communications, lists, logs or datasets specific to law enforcement.



The Department's written procedures and guidelines and a summary thereof can be viewed at: www.michigan.gov/foia-dtmb<http://www.michigan.gov/foia-dtmb> .



As to the denial determination, pursuant to section 10 of the FOIA, you may do either of the following:



1.            Appeal this decision in writing to the DTMB Director Michelle Lange, Elliott-Larsen Building, 320 South Walnut, P.O. Box 30026, Lansing, Michigan 48909.  The writing must specifically state the word "appeal" and must identify the reasons you believe the denial should be reversed.  The head of the department must respond to your appeal within 10 business days of its receipt.  Under unusual circumstances, the time for response to your appeal may be extended by 10 business days.



2.            File an action in the Court of Claims within 180 days after the final denial determination.  If you prevail in such an action the court is to award reasonable attorney fees, costs, disbursements, and possible damages.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

  *   State of Michigan, DTMB contracts may be available free of charge at: DTMB - Contract List (michigan.gov)<https://www.michigan.gov/dtmb/procurement/contractconnect/contract-list>
  *   A public copy of bidders proposals may be available free of charge at: DTMB - Bid Proposals (michigan.gov)<https://www.michigan.gov/dtmb/procurement/contractconnect/bid-proposals>
  *   For current bids, please visit:  Welcome to CGI Advantage Vendor Self Service Portal: Home (michigan.gov)<https://sigma.michigan.gov/webapp/PRDVSS2X1/AltSelfService>
  *   The FOIA email address for DTMB Central Procurement Services is:  DTMB-PurchFOIA@michigan.gov<mailto:DTMB-PurchFOIA@michigan.gov> . Please use this address when requesting information and/or documents from DTMB Central Procurement.
  *   DTMB Central Procurement Services has a FOIA Request Form available.  You can find the form via the following link: https://www.michigan.gov/dtmb/0,5552,7-358-82550_85746_48677-57230--,00.html
Best,

Tamara J. Fleming
Asst FOIA Coordinator & State Administrative Board Claims Analyst, Knowledge Center
Central Procurement Services - Customer Experience
State of Michigan, Elliott-Larsen 2N
517-388-5773
FlemingT3@michigan.gov<mailto:FlemingT3@michigan.gov>

[cid:image001.png@01DA745F.90248AC0]
Think Procurement is doing a great job? Nominate our staff for an Employee Recognition Award!<https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/DTMBProcurementRecognition>

title: NIAID collaboration with "American Masters" (PBS) episode on Dr. Anthony Fauci

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NIAID collaboration with "American Masters" (PBS) episode on Dr. Anthony Fauci
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records pertaining to NIAID involvement with the production of the March 21, 2023, episode of "American Masters" on PBS featuring Dr. Anthony Fauci. The documentary was filmed in 2021, when Dr. Fauci was still the director of NIAID. I request any and all documents pertaining to NIAID involvement, including but not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of NIAID and this PBS production.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo
